Comfort food.description: Baked pasta with marinara sauce and cheese.

Comfort food.name: French Fries
Comfort food.description: Crispy, deep-fried potato strips, often served as a side dish.

Comfort food.name: Pot Roast
Comfort food.description: Slow-cooked beef with vegetables in a rich gravy.

Comfort food.name: Lasagna
Comfort food.description: Layers of pasta with meat (or vegetable) sauce, cheese, and béchamel.

Comfort food.name: Chicken and Waffles
Comfort food.description: Fried chicken served on top of a waffle, often with syrup.

Comfort food.name: Hot Dish
Comfort food.description: A casserole dish made with a starch, meat, and canned vegetables.

Comfort food.name: Fish and Chips
Comfort food.description: Battered and deep-fried fish served with crispy fries.

Comfort food.name: Fried Chicken
Comfort food.description: Chicken pieces breaded and deep-fried to a crispy golden brown.

Comfort food.name: Bread Pudding
Comfort food.description: A dessert made with stale bread, milk, eggs, sugar, and spices.

Comfort food.name: Apple Pie
Comfort food.description: A traditional dessert made with spiced apple filling in a pastry crust.

Comfort food.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
Comfort food.description: A warm soup made with chicken, noodles, and vegetables in broth.

Comfort food.description: Ground beef in seasoned tomato sauce on a round bun.

Comfort food.description: Thinly sliced potatoes baked with cream, butter, and cheese.

Comfort food.name: Ratatouille
Comfort food.description: A vegetable stew made with eggplant, zucchini, and peppers.

Quick meal.description: Sliced avocado spread on toasted bread, often topped with salt and pepper.

Quick meal.name: Smoothie Bowl
Quick meal.description: Frozen fruit blended into a thick consistency, served in a bowl with toppings.

Quick meal.name: Cucumber Sandwich
Quick meal.description: Simple sandwich with thinly sliced cucumber on buttered bread.

Quick meal.name: Caprese Salad
Quick meal.description: A salad made with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, basil, olive oil, and balsamic.

Quick meal.name: Grilled Chicken Salad
Quick meal.description: Salad topped with grilled chicken breast, often with a vinaigrette dressing.

Quick meal.name: Tuna Salad

Quick meal.name: Chicken Caesar Wrap
Quick meal.description: Grilled chicken, Caesar salad, and dressing wrapped in a tortilla.

Quick meal.description: A sandwich made with bacon, lettuce, and tomato.

Quick meal.name: Cheese Omelette
Quick meal.description: Egg omelette filled with melted cheese.

Quick meal.name: Pasta Salad
Quick meal.description: Cold pasta mixed with vegetables and dressing.

Quick meal.name: Chicken Tenders
Quick meal.description: Breaded and fried strips of chicken breast.

Quick meal.name: Garlic Bread
Quick meal.description: Bread spread with butter, garlic, and herbs, then toasted.

Quick meal.name: Stuffed Mushrooms
Quick meal.description: Mushrooms filled with cheese, breadcrumbs, and herbs, then baked.

Quick meal.name: Margarita Pizza
Quick meal.description: Pizza topped with tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil.

Quick meal.name: Falafel
Quick meal.description: Deep-fried balls of chickpeas and herbs, often served in pita bread.

Quick meal.name: Hummus with Pita
Quick meal.description: Chickpea dip served with soft pita bread.

Quick meal.name: Crispy Tofu
Quick meal.description: Tofu fried until crispy, often served with dipping sauces.

Quick meal.description: Flour tortilla filled with grilled chicken, rice, beans, and salsa.

Quick meal.name: Breakfast Burrito
Quick meal.description: A tortilla filled with eggs, sausage or bacon, cheese, and salsa.

Quick meal.name: Pita Bread with Hummus
Quick meal.description: Pita bread served with creamy hummus.

Quick meal.name: Poke Bowl
Quick meal.description: A bowl of raw fish, typically tuna, served with rice and various toppings.

Quick meal.name: Vegetable Stir-fry
Quick meal.description: Mixed vegetables stir-fried in soy sauce and spices.

Quick meal.name: Banh Mi
Quick meal.description: Vietnamese sandwich with meat, pickled vegetables, and herbs on a baguette.

Adventure cuisine.name: Ceviche
Adventure cuisine.description: Raw fish marinated in citrus juice, typically served with onions and cilantro.

Adventure cuisine.name: Sushi
Adventure cuisine.description: Raw fish or seafood on vinegared rice, sometimes wrapped in seaweed.

Adventure cuisine.name: Escargot
Adventure cuisine.description: Snails cooked in garlic butter and herbs.

Adventure cuisine.name: Durian
Adventure cuisine.description: A tropical fruit known for its strong odor and creamy, custard-like interior.

Adventure cuisine.name: Balut
Adventure cuisine.description: A fertilized duck egg, typically boiled and served in its shell.

Adventure cuisine.name: Fried Tarantula
Adventure cuisine.description: Deep-fried tarantula served as a crunchy snack.

Adventure cuisine.name: Hákarl
Adventure cuisine.description: Icelandic fermented shark, known for its strong smell and unique taste.

Adventure cuisine.name: Crocodile Steak
Adventure cuisine.description: Grilled or fried crocodile meat, often served as an exotic delicacy.

Adventure cuisine.name: Kangaroo Meat
Adventure cuisine.description: Lean and gamey meat, often grilled or pan-fried.

Adventure cuisine.name: Fugu
Adventure cuisine.description: Pufferfish, delicately prepared by licensed chefs to avoid poisonous parts.

Adventure cuisine.name: Rocky Mountain Oysters
Adventure cuisine.description: Fried bull or calf testicles, often served as a novelty dish.

Adventure cuisine.name: Black Pudding
Adventure cuisine.description: Blood sausage made from pork blood, fat, and oatmeal.

Adventure cuisine.name: Octopus Sashimi
Adventure cuisine.description: Raw octopus, often served thinly sliced as sushi or sashimi.

Adventure cuisine.name: Biltong
Adventure cuisine.description: Dried cured meat, often made from beef or game meats.

Adventure cuisine.name: Haggis
Adventure cuisine.description: A savory pudding made with sheep's heart, liver, and lungs, mixed with oats and spices.

Adventure cuisine.name: Fried Alligator
Adventure cuisine.description: Alligator meat breaded and deep-fried, commonly served with dipping sauces.

Adventure cuisine.name: Bee Larvae
Adventure cuisine.description: Larvae of bees, sometimes fried or used in soups and stews.

Adventure cuisine.name: Caterpillar Soup
Adventure cuisine.description: Soup made from caterpillars, commonly found in parts of Africa and Asia.

Adventure cuisine.name: Cuy
Adventure cuisine.description: Guinea pig meat, often roasted or fried, a traditional dish in South America.

Adventure cuisine.name: Lutefisk
Adventure cuisine.description: Dried fish reconstituted in a lye solution, often served with butter and potatoes.

Adventure cuisine.name: Jellyfish Salad
Adventure cuisine.description: A salad made from sliced jellyfish, often served with vinegar and sesame oil.

Adventure cuisine.name: Sauted Ants
Adventure cuisine.description: Ants cooked in a variety of ways, often sautéed or fried.

Adventure cuisine.name: Witchetty Grub
Adventure cuisine.description: A large, edible grub of a moth, often roasted or eaten raw.

Adventure cuisine.name: Ceviche de Pulpo
Adventure cuisine.description: Octopus marinated in citrus juices, commonly served as a seafood ceviche.

Adventure cuisine.name: Snake Soup
Adventure cuisine.description: Soup made from various types of snake, often served as a medicinal dish.

Adventure cuisine.name: Tuna Heart
Adventure cuisine.description: The heart of a tuna fish, often served raw or lightly cooked.

Adventure cuisine.name: Salo
Adventure cuisine.description: A traditional Ukrainian dish made from salted pork fat.

Adventure cuisine.name: Worm Salt
Adventure cuisine.description: A powdery condiment made from ground worms, used in Mexican cuisine.

Adventure cuisine.name: Yak Butter Tea
Adventure cuisine.description: A traditional Tibetan tea made with yak butter, salt, and tea leaves.

Adventure cuisine.name: Mopane Worms
Adventure cuisine.description: Large edible caterpillars, often dried or fried, a traditional snack in Southern Africa.
